com.cloudera.oryx.als.common.factorizer

Interface MatrixFactorizer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Callable<Object>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlternatingLeastSquares

    public interface MatrixFactorizer
extends Callable<Object>
    Implementations of this interface can factor a matrix into two matrices X and Y, typically of much lower rank.
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Void call()
      Run the factorization algorithm to completion.
      LongObjectMap<float[]> getX()
      Typically called after call() has finished.
      LongObjectMap<float[]> getY()
      Typically called after call() has finished.
      void setPreviousY(LongObjectMap<float[]> previousY)
      Use the given matrix as the initial state of Y.

    • Method Detail

      • call

        Void call()
   throws ExecutionException,
          InterruptedException
        Run the factorization algorithm to completion. Results are available from getX() and getY() afterwards.
        Specified by:
        call in interface Callable<Object>
        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if an exception occurs during factorization; see Throwable.getCause() for reason
        InterruptedException - if algorithm cannot complete because its computation was interrupted

      • setPreviousY

        void setPreviousY(LongObjectMap<float[]> previousY)
        Use the given matrix as the initial state of Y. May be ignored.
        Parameters:
        previousY - initial matrix state

      • getX

        LongObjectMap<float[]> getX()
        Typically called after call() has finished.
        Returns:
        the current user-feature matrix, X

      • getY

        LongObjectMap<float[]> getY()
        Typically called after call() has finished.
        Returns:
        the current item-feature matrix, Y
